paper_abstract: We show that the de Bruijn graph is appropriate for maintaining dynamic connections, e.g., between the members of a P2P application who join and leave the system at their convenience. We describe the content-addressable network D2B, based on an overlay network preserving de Bruijn connections dynamically, and on a distributed hash table (DHT) supporting efficient publish and search procedures. The overlay network has constant expected degree, and any publish or search operation in the DHT takes a logarithmic expected number of steps. (c) 2006 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: D2B: A de Bruijn based content-addressable network
